captions.text: I want to know
what it's like
to be normal
to be accepted
to be human
to be equal
to be free.
I want to know
what it's like
to be open
to be heard
to be loved
to be happy
to be me.
I want to know what it's like
to feel like I belong
to feel like I am strong
that who I am, isn't wrong.
I want to know what it's like
to know that I am here, that I'll make it through the year
to know that I won't... disappear.
I want to know what it's like
to not have to fight, to see an end in sight
to make what is wrong, right.
I want to know what it's like, to be able to believe
in a higher power that doesn't see
me as sin, or sodomy.
I want to know what it's like
to have liberty and justice for all,
to break down this dividing wall
to remove homophobia, from the law.
I want to know what it's like
to have a feeling that isn't sad
to have something that I've never had
to have a child call me Dad.
I want to know what it's like
to not feel like I'm a freak
to not feel like I am weak
to not be silenced when I speak.
I want to know what it's like, to live beyond a closet door
to see my father once more
to show him I'm not who I was before.
I want to know what it's like
to donate the blood from my veins
but because I'm gay I must refrain
why does my sexuality pertain?!
I want to know what it's like

to not be expelled from school, to not 
 be made to look like a fool
how is my homosexuality breaking a rule?!
I want to know what it's like
to undo what's been done to me
to give sight to those who cannot see
that I am no lesser of a human being.
I want to know what it's like
to not be considered a disease
to not have majority I have to please
to freely express my individuality.
I want to know what it's like
to live in a land truly of the free
NOT a land that excludes me
this is not how it's supposed to be!
I want to know what it's like
to not be the target of bigotry
to not have you question my sanity
to not succumb to your superiority.
I want to know what it's like
to overcome all of my fears
to uncry these countless tears, that have been shed over the years
I want to know what it's like
to learn about Gay leaders of the past in my high school history class
I want to know what it's like
can somebody please tell me what is so wrong with that?!
I want to know what it's like

to have pride, to not have to hide, to 
 not have to lie my whole life.
to not have my sexuality be denied.

I want to know what it's like, to 
 not have to feel this hurt inside
to not think these thoughts in my mind
to not contemplate suicide.
I want to know what it's like, to have this pain in me subside
to to heal this wound that bleeds inside.

to get back the tears that I've cried, to 
 take back the years that I've tried
to bring back the life that has died.
to unite this world's divide
to make change with stride
to not stand below, but beside.
I want to know what it's like
to have this choice you say is mine.
to have science and religion intertwine.
to have love be redefined.
I want to know what it's like
to have a government that wont instate, unfair laws that provoke hate
for fear that society will disintegrate.
I want to know what it's like
to live in a world without hate!
a world that does not discriminate!
a world in which I can feel safe!
a world in which I can feel safe!
whether I am Gay, Bi, or Straight.
this is the world we must create!!
these are the actions we must take,
these are the decisions we must make!
the time is NOW,
we cannot, we must not, we will not
wait.
I want to know what it's like
to have equal opportunity
to know full equality.
to be one humanity.
I want to know what it's like
to be treated equally by my peers
to stand alongside every Queer
on the edge of a new frontier.
a frontier that no one will dictate.
a frontier where there will be no debate.
a frontier in which everyone can relate.
a frontier made up of love,
and not hate.
I want to know what it's like
to open your eyes, so you can see.
the way this world is supposed to be.
that we aren't so different,
you and me.

title: I Want To Know What It's Like

comments.text:
One year, I convinced my class to not recite the pledge of allegiance every 
morning because it is not true. Our nation is the most diverse country, it 
is not only "under God." It brainwashes us into thinking our country is a 
utopia. We are not "indivisible" if we separate ourselves due to prejudice. 
And mostly, we don't have "liberty and justice for all," unless you have a 
really fucked up idea of what liberty is. "All" does not mean 'except the 
minority' it means 'everyone.'﻿

comments.text:
Why do you fear me? Why do you hate me? You don't even know me. You choose 
to believe that I am evil. You choose to say I am lesser. You tell me that 
I am disgusting. It isn't God. It isn't government. It's you. You're the 
one deciding that I am not normal, and you're just hiding behind anything 
that promotes your theory. No...you're afraid of me because you can't see 
beyond your own world. You can't comprehend more than what has been burned 
into your mind. Why should I listen to your opinion? Why should you get to 
choose my life for me? You, who has chosen hate. You, who has never given 
me a chance. You, who can't even see beyond your own selfish reality. 
No...you don't get to choose my life. You don't get to say you are more 
deserving than I. You can't change who I love. You can't stop my love. You 
hate me...but I love you. You want me dead, I just want you to understand. 
Scream at me, kick the walls, break glass. I will still try to teach 
you...love.﻿

comments.author: TheZutarian Athiest

comments.text:
If you have a couple of free minutes to use, please watch this video. 
Although there are more and more people coming out of the closet to openly 
say that they are gay, discrimination against gay people is still very 
known. 
This video is mostly surrounded by the words *"I want to know what it's 
like...".* For many gay people, they live in fear wondering what could 
possibly happen to them or their lives if they were to open up to the world 
of their sexual orientation. They too are human and would wish to know what 
it's like to be free, happy, strong, accepted, and so much more. 
I promise you that this video is not a waste of time watching. Although I 
am straight, I really do believe that this video sends out a strong clear 
message. 

Youtube link: I Want To Know What It's Like

- Darling, You'll be okay ﻿
comments.author: Randy Casey (Ero-Bear)

(*Credit goes to ***+Darling, You'll be okay* for finding this video.*)

So many more people should see this video. I, personally am heterosexual, 
but I know people who are not and I love them. I don't have anything 
against them. I'm a Christian, but I hate that the people in my religion, 
are the cruelest to others. I don't want to hurt people and tell them to 
change just because I don't approve. Heck, it's your life, you can choose 
who you want to be or what you want to wear or what you look like. It's 
your choice. Everyone else has the right to that so why not people with 
different sexualities. They deserve to be free from the stereotypes, pain, 
and words that hurt more than knives piercing skin and why do we do this if 
we're suppose to be united? It's not fair. And I want to do everything I 
can to change that. It's your life, it's your choice, it's your today, and 
don't let anyone tell you differently. Because all those names, you are 
above them. They are not you. They don't define you. They don't own you. 
You are you by the brilliant thoughts you think, the way you're eyes go 
wild and shine brightly with excitement when you're happy, the way you 
smile and it lights up the whole room, the way you're heart, soul, mind, 
and spirit are your own and are the definition of beauty and perfection. 
It's your life, make your own choices, and don't let anyone tell you that 
it's not. 

I Want To Know What It's Like﻿
comments.author: Project Happiness

comments.text:
+Ethan Dyckman, you have the right to your opinion, you have the right to 
choose. You can choose whether or not to support it, just don't be unkind 
to them.
comments.author: Project Happiness

comments.text:
I don't support cause I support traditional marriage, the way God created 
it.
But, i will tell you that if i say i don't support gay marriage, i get so 
much hate.
I almost deleted my google+ because of the names i was being called and how 
ridiculed i felt for standing up for what I believe.
That made me sad. :(
comments.author: Ethan ™

comments.text:
One sad thing is that many people who support gay marriage hate people who 
don't support gay marriage. I think that people can have their own 
opinions, but they should still show respect to everyone, even if their 
opinions are different. I personally do not have much of an opinion on gay 
marriage.
comments.author: Cindy Z.

comments.text:
If you have a couple of free minutes to use, please watch this video. 
Although there are more and more people coming out of the closet to openly 
say that they are gay, discrimination against gay people is still very 
known. 
This video is mostly surrounded by the words *"I want to know what it's 
like...".* For many gay people, they live in fear wondering what could 
possibly happen to them or their lives if they were to open up to the world 
of their sexual orientation. They too are human and would wish to know what 
it's like to be free, happy, strong, accepted, and so much more. 
I promise you that this video is not a waste of time watching. Although I 
am straight, I really do believe that this video sends out a strong clear 
message. 

Youtube link: I Want To Know What It's Like

- Darling, You'll be okay ﻿
comments.author: Darling, You'll be okay

comments.text:
I live in Belarus (a country near Russia). I'm 17 years old. In my life, 
everything changed after my classmates knew I was gay. With me were afraid 
to sit next to, say hello, to chat. I was always alone. The teacher said 
that we freaks that Western countries are crazy. Kidding me. First, behind 
my back, and then mocked me without embarrassment.Nobody wants to listen, 
that is ok. How many times have I heard that we need to kill, burn, exile 
to the uninhabited islands. But I have a friend who supports me! I am very 
grateful! And I am also grateful to the people in other countries who have 
supported us!﻿
comments.author: Саша Подколзин Саша Подколзин
